comments.body:
Elytra will never be combinable with chestplates, please read here: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360005029872-Previously-Considered-Feedback

I don't understand why the bracer armor slot is necessary. It seems to me that it would be more realistic to hold items with our actual hands...

I could see the bracer slot being useful, used for a new arm guard type of armor.  It might also allow us to have climbing gloves, which would sacrifice that armor slot but allow us to climb up a two-high barrier.
I feel that it is complete.

The bracer is a piece of armor that covered a medieval soldier’s elbow to wrist. In this case I would like to stretch it out from shoulder to wrist instead so it would fit the area that is not already covered by armor. Also, this armor peice is not really necessary but it seems weird that armor covers all parts of the player’s body except his or her arms. This also gives possibilties for new enchantments (like clay goddesses climbing idea) and for another piece of armor to mess around with and mine for.

It would be nice to have enchantments and curses for bracers. For example, for more damage/attack speed in hand-to-hand combat; fast climbing ladders/vines/stems; greater distance for throwing potions/pearls/snowballs.

Either the maximum armour would need to be increased, or the armour from one or more of the other armour parts would need to be reduced to make room for the bracers. I'm more in favour of the former--if the player is paying the extra cost in resources for more armour, they should be rewarded with more armour. Perhaps make it provide a similar value to the leggings. As armour was being phased out in our real world history, it was the armour on the feet and legs that went away before the armour on the hands and arms.

Possible armour values:

  • Leather Bracers: 2(1)A
  • Gold Bracers: 3(1.5)A
  • Copper Bracers: 3(1.5)A
  • Chainmail Sleeves: 4(2)A
  • Iron Bracers: 5(2.5)A
  • Diamond Bracers: 6(3)A+2(1)T
  • Netherite Bracers: 6(3)A+3(1.5)T+1(10%)KBR

This would modify the armour values of the full sets to:

  • Leather: 7(3.5)A<9(4.5)A
  • Copper: 10(5)A<13(6.5)A
  • Gold: 11(5.5)A<14(7)A
  • Chainmail: 12(6)A<15(7.5)A
  • Iron: 15(7.5)A<20(10)A
  • Diamond: 20(10)A+8(4)T<26(13)A+10(5)T
  • Netherite: 20(10)A+12(6)T+4(40%)KBR<26(13)A+15(7.5)T+5(50%)KBR

However, this would mean that someone in full Diamond or Netherite would be totally immune to most damage, at least until their armour points drop down to below 25 armour, or 12.5 armour bits. Depending on who you ask, this could be a worthy reward for resource expenditure of the two rarest resources, or boringly OP. Still though, the idea of making a full set of Iron Armour able to fill out the armour bar feels right in a way. If this were to happen in this way, it would also be ideal to represent armour greater than 20 by retexturing overlapping armour point with diamond, especially since diamond or better are the only way to acquire that layer of defense naturally.
I'd say that's very imbalanced and against the spirit of Minecraft.
That is super easy. All you need is a pressure plate connected to a dispenser with ender pearls and record where you end up. Then just build a fake little teleportation receiver there. Easy.

I like the idea if there is a big cost of use or a big cost of creation to it, so that other forms of travel (boat, elytra, nether,..) are still preferable in distances less than 1000 blocks and this is a solution for very far distance travel (e.g. 100.000 blocks)

Also, looking at the nether, the end portal, ender pearls and chorus fruit, I don't see teleportation as violating a Minecraft spirit.

@GoldenGamer9870: Are you sure this works with the dispenser? I have some doubts.

I had a similar idea;

  • Place a 2x2 grid of glazed terracotta with an identical matching set above it (leaving a 2 block gap to 'stand' in).
  • The terracotta does not have to be the same colour or be orientated in a specific direction (this give a huge variation of 16x16x4 = 1024 possible combinations)
  • Use an identical grid somewhere else in the world
  • When redstone power is applied to the top or bottom it links them with a "beam" of warp in the middle, joining the two pads (same wibbly as a portal)
  • Stepping into one will TP you to the closest powered grid that matches the pattern.
  • If you place a sign on any of the terracotta, only the named players on the sign can see that TP pad when coming in.

Just about every MC server uses some sort of TP mechanic - it would be really useful to build it into single player game mode so you can move between villages or explore and have a cool way to jump from one base to another.

Using this method would also allow redstone geniuses to create multiple destinations with block swapping mechanisms, and allow players to create really 'secret bases' and/or hide access within a patterned floor.
Umm no its too easy likereally easy and it have more end theme than nether

367211566351 you need to be more specific with your ideas, Do you craft the telepad? Do you build the telepad? Do you find the telepad? And on your security camera post, how do you craft it? Is there a certain way to hook it up to the tv? How do you craft the tv? I'm just saying, i think you need to be more specific. Just saying.
I thought of that a lot of times and it would be very very useful as a beam in many buildings. I also think that an iron bar-like one is needed, perhaps a bit thicker.

I’d say something like ‘Rods’ which can be placed in any orientation and act like End Rods. All varieties of fence, wall and iron bars should have this option. They would look like a wall or fence post but they can go any way around and would not connect up to each other like fences and walls. They do connect like fences to solid blocks if placed parallel to the block it is attached to. For example, if I place it running up and down but against a block in the air, because its only supporting block is the one beside it, it attaches. If the was a block above or below than it would not attach. It attaches if the only blocks beside it are against its long face.

I could see many uses for this as well as sideways walls, especially if they do not connect when sideways, I often use a wall and a few fence posts for lamp posts and when building a construction site would be great to be able to place the lampposts sideways like on pallets.

I was thinking of something like this too, it would be grate for making tiny trees or perches for pet birds.

They should be placed like End Rods and logs are, but in addition the horizontal fences should connect to vertical fences if they are next to each other, making corners/intersections in the fence ┓┨╋ ┳ ┗

it would be great for small details
Yes and walls should do this to, the name could be beams. For example Oak wood beam, Granite beam, etc.
This would be amazing for things like cattle grids, railings and creative things like that. There could also be horizontal walls alongside this.
We need this
Use your hands!
Use your hands!

Add hoes into the mix too! 

Break leaves, till dirt, etc.

I think it would be good to add the hoe as well.  When using the side functionality on grass it turns to path, course dirt turns to dirt, dirt or path turns to farmland (giving the normal hoe the ability to turn paths into farmland would help there as well).

Instead of it being a physical combination, it could be like a big swiss army knife; changing into what you need at the time.  In this case, I suggest making it with one of each tool: axe, pickaxe, shovel, and hoe in each of the four corners of the crafting grid with redstone (or better, a redstone block) in the center.
This would completely take away the use of shovels, picks, and axes. Minecraft does NOT need this.
I agree with the placeable milk, not the cow punching.
Milk1234
I thought it would be nice to spill milk on the floor. But, you don’t write about spill a milk. You just saying about retouch how to milk
Spilling the milk is what I want, not the cow punching thing
Yes to pourable milk, no to cow punching.
Yes! Totally need this! I find myself constantly wanting more stair and slab types, especially for making roofs.
Nice idea

I think this is a good idea, but, although I like the idea, I'm not quite sure if different arrow heads would fit into the game very well. I think it should be used to repair bows and crossbows with string, too. Also, it should be used to upgrade arrows by adding or maybe taking away feathers, similar to how you can upgrade a map in cartography tables. Adding feathers would stabilize your arrow and make it more accurate, while subtracting arrows would speed it up, but it would be less accurate.
Minecraft needs more weapons

I have a prediction for the fletching table, or at the very least a suggestion if it is wrong. I think that the new archeology implementation, maybe you can find arrow heads there. There might be different kinds and types of arrow heads, like maybe granite, andesite, or diorite. These different types would have trade-offs, like if it does more damage, it would be slower and go less far. These arrow heads would be made into new kinds of arrows only through the fletching table. This is only a prediction, but it might be wrong.

If you want some use of fletching table then vote
Making use of fletching table
There they have given a good use to be added
copper is highly resistant to corrosion. Perhaps you meant "oxidize"?

Perhaps Copper should also oxidise at different rates depending on whether it is in contact with water/air. So if you surround it with glass or barrier blocks, no visible corrosion should take place? And what about the oxidisation happening quicker in higher altitudes (where there would be more water vapour condensing on the copper blocks)?

Copper shuold corrode slower in general. Right now it's 16 minecraft days (5:20 hours). That's way too fast.

It kind of defeats the historic purpose of the corrosion.

At least 64 minecraft days (21:20 hours) should be decent.

 

Minecraft streamers and daily players might prefer 128 to 512.
Maybe change the title to "Copper should corrode faster/slower" without "in different biomes". It refers to more people.

I think this is a good idea, especially so that it would make for more diversity in builds. Also it might make it possible to farm the oxidized variants of copper, and I think it fits, especially since they have such specific things like how snow golems don't leave snow in jungles. Lastly, I'm assuming that biomes such as forests and Plaines are by default the current oxidation rate, right?
Each biome has a hidden humidity level that is moslty unused. Perhaps the copper could oxidize at different rates depending on the Biome humidity.
It's like a disease. They could spread! But there should be a way to stop it too.
This would be brilliant!  I'm always worried about using vines in my builds and hiding a rose in the walls would make that so much easier!!
Grass and dirt should covert to coarse dirt in that same radius, although with a maximum of only 10 blocks in the 25 space

Interesting idea another interesting feature that might go with it the conversion of grass blocks overtime within that radius.

Something where each grass block would have set chance of becoming a dirt block every set amount of ticks. For example each grass block surrounding the wither rose would have a 5% chance of becoming a dirt block every 2400 ticks. This sort of thing could also possibly apply to the leaves of trees as well where they would only disappear.

This was mentioned previously, and it would be odd if there was only a single wood bow, and then suddenly a top tier netherite bow.

So, maybe add bows of different wood types with different damages and fire rates, and types for different armor tiers (except leather).
Maybe we could make with a bow and a netherite ingot in a smithing table. There would now be more uses for the smithing table.
intead of a Netherrite bow it could be called a compost bow
This would be terrible for anyone wanting to build something outdoors with the concrete powder texture specifically.
Bad idea, concrete powder makes a good road texture, and to remove the ability to do this would create a fuss in the building community.
Yes very minor thing but should be in game it doesn’t make sense that it’s not.
But maybe they should add a way to to prevent the concrete powder from solidifying
maybe a chance to happen is better than having it always.

I realize it's just a game, but I find the in-game recipes for "concrete powder" could be better (and actually contain cement -not just sand, gravel,& color dye) - concrete with just sand & gravel?

I feel like in Minecraft -cement should come from mining something like a limestone block & then using the workbench to turn the limestone into cement powder & then the recipe should be:

Concrete Mix: Cement powder, gravel (then you would add it to water to make the block) - default color gray

or if you wanted a colored concrete block simply adding it to the recipe as it currently is
I really hope that they separate stone and blackstone, after all how is it still gray?

Blackstone doors, blackstone pickaxes, blackstone pistons, HOORAY!

 

Piglins can mine gold now! With blackstone pickaxes. Only blackstone is very confusable with netherite.
Definitely. Perhaps even a new texture for Blackstone armor stands?
i think if you make anything that are made with stone but with blackstone, we should get blackstoe variants of them like we do with different wood variants, my idea
Good idea

I think opaque volcanic glass (obsidian) would be a better choice.

But I do want to be able to hide my beacons.
Give us pastel blue and pastel pink wood p l e a s e, Mojang.
Yeah and maybe from that we can create different colour chests or sticks to craft tools
Give all pastel color wood PLEAS 💗😢🙏💗
i really would like mojang to do this because it would give builders a lot more variety in their bulids
Great Idea! Nice details!

A new update idea to my previous detailed post.
Jelly Monster, hostile mob, spawned in Snowy Mountain Biomes.

It may drop exp and Jelly Cubes. (Which are edible)
When you combine 9 Jelly Cubes, you can craft a Jelly Block which wherever you place it -
It draws nearby Bees and Silverfish, due it's being sweet.

In case you place the Jelly Block near lava or a torch it will melt into a dissolved jelly liquid that can't flow, you can collect it with a bucket.

You can place the 'Jelly drops in the bucket' into a furnace, you will smelt "Gelatin Powder".
You can craft 8 Arrows + 1 Gelatin Powder and you get 8 'Jelly Coated Arrows'.

Whenever you shoot a mob with one of the Jelly Coated Arrows, the mob will convert unto a Hardened Jelly Statue of the same shape of the mob.

You can pick it up with any tool that has Silk Touch Enchant.
And place it wherever you want, near the base entrance or inside a hall of fame.

I think even using dyes on the statue could change the the color of it would be a great additional cosmetic feature to the game.
Yes! I love this! Then if you drink a specific smoothie it gives you special effects! <3 this post

Maybe there could be a blender that you would craft with iron and redstone that would blend the fruits together to make smoothies. When drinking a smoothie, it could heal six hunger. You could put any fruit in the blender, and different mixtures would have different textures.
If there would be different kinds of eggs that are throwable or used in a recipe then I can see this be added in game.
Idkvuhnl
ارجو ان ده لاني Egg
انا ميشتغل
Makes sense.
What do you mean by dye in it to fire colored water? You're talking about 2 different things.

Read the Previously considered suggestions. In general notes line 3

 

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360005029872
I mean mixing the Diy Color in Water pistol to fire colored water..
No guns of any kind. I like it but not going to happen.
@Some Animal What its just a water pistol you can easily get in real life not violent as well..

I love your  i

dea mincrafft should post it

Happy Saxena, I do not mean that it is too violent to be in the game, Swords and Bows are just as violent as guns, but I believe water pistols, like guns, do not fit the theme of the game. At least blunderbusses, are more archaic than the brightly colored plastics of modern age toys. But if Blunderbusses and muskets, and even cannons are too futuristic for the mine craft world, then it must be that we are seeing a game in the bronze gold or iron ages, guns would not fit minecraft at all. Pre-Bronze age makes the most sense due to the extremely low population.

I don't think this needs to even be a biome, if it was a natural event that had a medium chance of triggering once every day it could be interesting. There could even be unique mobs that spawn while the ash storm is on. Sounds cool!
Would be a great addition to the nether update, like a nether version of the snow biomes.

Instead of a biome, it could also replace the top Bedrock layer of the Nether allowing the player to get to the top half of the nether without heating. This would be very useful for red-stoners, and for transportation. To make sure this is not overpowered, it would have to be hard to mine.

I was about the post the same thing, then I saw this, and I was like,

"Yeeaah, now that's what I'm talkin' about."

I say this is a wonderful idea,

And, Heck,

Maybe we can create a Nether version of snowmen, that die in cold environments.

 

Anyone else agree...?
That sounds like a good idea, I think it would look like this... plus I think you should also be able to get ashes to use in fertilizer barrels or to throw like snowballs~

This would be a great addition to Minecraft, and maybe (if the biome/condition is not too common) the ashes could be crafted into wither potions or something.

It would look like gravel or sand but darker, and its item would look like darker gunpowder.

What about an event to go with it called "Ashfall"?
Ash will start falling more heavily  and getting deposited like snow in the Basalt Deltas and Soul Sand Valley Biomes and you would be able to pick it up like snow and get Ash piles, which you could use to craft blocks of ash which would behave like sand, and with which you could use in place of sand to make glass.
I was going to do a post similar to this but in mine I was going to say that a falling ash weather event could work in either the nether or a volcano biome if volcano's get added.

And for uses ash block can be crafted with dirt block to produce fertilized soil block, which will permanently make process of growing plants and crops faster without use of bonemeal since ash is good fertilizers in real world.
Giving it properties of gravity like sand and sinking like powder snow will useful to make it good trap block.
In my opinion, the ash layer could appear in the basalt deltas.
Hope this blows up, its an amazing idea.
Glad to hear it Magnus. Hopefully it does. Be sure to share it :)

I absolutely agree, this would be a huge benefit to builders in survival.

 

In the meantime for anyone googling for a good solution, if you use half slabs you can stop mobs from spawning and it's a lot prettier than torches. If the slab is in line with the top half of a block mobs can spawn there, but if it lines up with the bottom half nothing will spawn. A lot of new slabs have been added to the game so this at least gives you a decent number of options.

This would be good, but this ruins a large part of the experience for Redstone contraption artists. I have a music disc farm that would be ruined by this. We would have to find a complete new design for creeper farms. If you want to build something, then use peaceful, or work it in to the build. I’m a dabbler in both building and Redstone, so I get that it’s difficult to do so, but this would make Redstone users have a heart attack.
I hope the lead can be used as a rope,which can help player up and down with the tie.;It can attach any entities;It can connect two entities;It can be thrown out to catch entities.
I had this same idea, it would be really nice for the builders! Of course there will have to be a limit to how long the lead is.
They could be used to hook onto and hang/swing from fences. It would be cool to swing around like spiderman, but they would have a short range and could snap if you are moving too fast.

Signal boost!: my main concern is that I have one million leads that are kindly donated by so many Wandering Traders in Bedrock, and I'm sure there is an ingenious way to expand on an already awesome item.
Yes, please! This would be so nice for bridges and catwalks.

Leads could be used as functional chains in some ways - 

  • Connecting two minecarts
  • Connecting boats
  • Dragging boats full of animals while rowing a chest-boat
  • Connecting mobs to other mobs e.g. dragging a herd of cows / horses / mules / donkeys / llamas etc. around
  • Connecting mobs to Redstone-Slime-Block machines by letting a fence being pushed by a piston keep it's attached lead.

Maybe in order for leads to function like this, players have to combine Leads with Chains to craft Reinforced Leads or Functional Chains (or whatever they may be called) to function like this instead, while having conventional leads remain how they are. I believe this could really make life easier in the game, while adding a whole bunch of small mechanics to everyday life in it.
Those ideas are nice, I would just simply like to be able to attach a lead fence to fence
what's the point when you never actually need a wooden sword?
That would be great! especially for an adventure map or server.
Genius!

I think this a great idea, especially for the game dynamics, as it adds on to the variations of boats, doors, and fences. They aren’t all the same wood, and swords (and perhaps the other wooden tools) and I don’t see the pain of adding them in.

It would more likely tickle the map maker’s fancy than would others, but I wait for the day I can make a cool looking “dark oak sword.” It gives a visual incentive for creating wooden tools.
When the Wither drops the nether star, it is fireproof and never despairs until the player picks it up.  If you fought the Wither and the nether star fell into lava, go get it! It’s still there!
Bilbo I tried that and I searched everywhere for it but unfortunately I never found it...
It’s in the Minecraft source code (I have read it) that netherstars do not burn if the Wither drops them.  I don’t know what happened to your netherstar.
Which versions do each of you play?  There's a chance one is on Java and the other on Bedrock and there is different behavior.
I play both.  The source code that makes nether stars not burn is for Java, but I assume that the nether star behaves the same for both.
I play Bedrock and it seems that the fireproof\ lava proof source code for the nether star only happens in Java
I tested this in bedrock, and the netherstar does indeed burn.  Voted.
Water (Lava) looked I would prefer, but I like this idea
Rock a kesr of

I strongly agree! I think that if the wither was killed over lava, it should be immune to lava like netherite items, blocks and debris. Also, what about accidentally threw it into lava or put in a garbage disposal that uses lava, make it retrievable. Beacons also should have this because they are made from nether stairs.
Say what!?! Maybe it can glow red for hostile mobs, yellow for neutral mobs, green for passive mobs, and blue for players!
I think that it would be cool if this also lets you see mobs or players who are invisible too!
Tipped arrows need to be crafted with a potion so spectral arrows should be made with this and give the awarness potion a new recipe like a potion of night vision and a ghast tear

It's a neat idea, and I like how it integrates kelp into the game, but they did specifically ask us to not focus on complicated prepared foods like this one, so....

And as for your bowl of water idea - you might be interested in this post that I wrote some time ago where I propose adding Bottles of Water to all of the soup recipes because, like you said, it just makes sense!

Edit: Thanks for the clarification, Nova! So, I actually like the idea quite a bit. I would just prefer if it were crafted with a bowl + water bottle, as per the post I linked above. Either way, you have my vote!

I read the rules that they wanted focus on crops and recipes having to do with those crops... i have to say it’s an confusing rule. How can you focus on a recipe when the outcome would be a prepared food anyway?

I figured I was ok because my focus is on the recipe and the challenge it brings.

The bowl of water isn’t a necessity. The other stews in the game don’t require water anyway.

It's not the world's clearest, but I've clarified that some. The spirit of it is crops and/or recipes (like this) vs a block or item that's just an already prepared food (like pizza). Hope that helps.
Gostaria que tivesse mais itens
